primary.context: Customer cannot access account to view balance or pay
primary.detail: The AI failed to verify the customer's name against the contract ID record and transferred to concierge.

steps: Customer requested to pay maintenance fees and reported account access issues.
Agent attempted account lookup via contract ID after phone number lookup was uncertain.
Agent found a record but the name provided by the customer (Sandra Haining) did not match the name on file (Kenneth Beaumont).
Agent attempted name verification multiple times.
Agent transferred the call to the concierge department due to verification failure.

failure.detail: Agent persisted in name verification loops despite the caller clearly being a different person than the name on file (Kenneth Beaumont).

clarifications.note: Agent asking to confirm name on contract

corrections.note: Customer denies name Kenneth Beaumont is correct

loops.subject: name verification
loops.note: Repeatedly asking for name spelling after mismatch

actions.detail: Looked up account using contract ID 350375
Name Sandra Haining did not match Kenneth Beaumont
Transferred to concierge after verification failure

insights.summary: The customer wanted to pay maintenance fees but was blocked by a name mismatch during verification. The AI found a record for 'Kenneth Beaumont' while the caller was 'Sandra Haining', leading to a transfer.
insights.verbatim: I'm looking at owner's invoice. And my name is on the owner's invoice. Sandra... Haining.
insights.coaching: When a name mismatch occurs but a record is found, the agent should recognize that the caller may be a spouse or family member and offer to transfer to a human rather than looping on name spelling.
